title: 105_hr1133
content: The Act titled "Fairness for Mentally Disabled New Americans Act of 1997" limits eligibility of qualified aliens for SSI and food stamps, with an exception for mentally disabled aliens. The "Fairness for Mentally Disabled New Americans Act of 1997" amends the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 to exempt certain disabled aliens from the eligibility restrictions for SSI and food stamps. The "Fairness for Mentally Disabled New Americans Act of 1997" amends the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 to exempt certain disabled aliens from eligibility restrictions for SSI and food stamps, effective as if included in the enactment of title IV. Limited eligibility of qualified aliens for temporary assistance, social services block grant, and Medicaid, with an exception for mentally disabled aliens. The amendment exempts mentally disabled qualified aliens from certain provisions of the Permanent Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996. The amendment exempts mentally disabled qualified aliens from certain provisions of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996. State authority to limit eligibility of qualified aliens for state public benefits, with an exception for mentally disabled aliens. The amendment exempts mentally disabled qualified aliens from certain restrictions on public benefits eligibility. Effective date is retroactive to the enactment of the relevant act. SEC. 413 prohibits state requirements of minimum US residence for mentally disabled aliens seeking state benefits. SEC. 6 of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 addresses the naturalization of mentally disabled permanent resident aliens. SEC. 6 of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 introduces a new section on the naturalization of mentally disabled permanent resident aliens. The Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 introduces a new section exempting mentally disabled permanent resident aliens from naturalization requirements if they are unable to comply due to developmental disability or mental impairment and have a US citizen guardian. This amendment applies to applications filed on or after the enactment date.
